loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Skill up -> Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: This reinforcing loop accelerates team growth as experienced core developers mentor others, increasing the promotion rate and expanding the core team, which further amplifies mentorship capacity.
citation_title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach
citation_relevance: Examines how socialization processes including mentoring lead to contributor growth and retention in OSS projects

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: This reinforcing loop directly strengthens the core team by increasing the promotion rate through mentorship, creating a self-reinforcing cycle of leadership development.

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Developer's Turnover -> Core Developer
description: This balancing loop stabilizes the core developer count by counteracting growth with natural attrition, such as burnout or career changes, preventing unlimited expansion.

loop_edges: Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Experienced Contributors
description: This balancing loop regulates the pool of experienced contributors by promoting them to the core team, which naturally limits its own growth and seeks a stable size.

loop_edges: New Contributors -> Skill up -> New Contributors
description: This balancing loop governs the onboarding process as new contributors who skill up graduate to experienced roles, preventing an indefinite accumulation of novices.
citation_title: The Hard Life of Open Source Software Project Newcomers
citation_authors: Steinmacher, I., Wiese, I., et al.
citation_relevance: Provides empirical evidence of how onboarding challenges and skill development regulate contributor progression
venue: IEEE/ACM International Conference on Connected Health: Applications, Systems and Engineering Technologies
